question: Affordable Care Act (ACA)
text:
Affordable Care Act (ACA)
          
        
The comprehensive health care reform law enacted in March 2010 (sometimes known as the ACA, or Obamacare). Virginia's Insurance Marketplace operates Virginia's state-based marketplace in accordance with the ACA.
The law provides numerous customer benefits and protections, including:

Making health coverage more accessible and affordable. The law provides customers with subsidies (
premium tax credits
) that lower costs for households with incomes between 100% and 400% of the federal poverty level.

Protecting individuals with pre-existing conditions from higher healthcare costs, while ensuring all customers have access to essential health benefits.

Expanding the Medicaid program to cover all adults with income below 138% of the federal poverty level. (Virginia has expanded its Medicaid program.)
